greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of Sum(1/p^p) where p is prime.
comment: This constant approximately equals 5226294/18187381. - _Yalcin Aktar_, Nov 05 2006
maple: P:=proc(n) local k,i; for i from 1 by 1 to n do print(evalf(sum('1/(ithprime(k)^ithprime(k))','k'=1..i),100)); od; end: P(100); # _Paolo P. Lava_ and _Giorgio Balzarotti_, Feb 07 2008
mathematica: digits = 105; n0 = 10; dn = 10; Clear[f]; f[n_] := f[n] = RealDigits[ Sum[ 1/Prime[k]^Prime[k], {k, 1, n}], 10, digits+5] // First; f[n = n0]; f[n = n+dn]; While[Print["n = ", n]; f[n] != f[n-dn], n = n+dn]; Take[f[n], digits] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 22 2013 *)
program: (PARI) ptothep(n) = { local(x,s,a); default(realprecision,200); s=0; forprime(x=2,n,s+=1./x^x); a=Vec(Str(s)); for(x=3,n,print1(eval(a[x]),",")) }
results.author: _Cino Hilliard_, Jul 31 2004
ext: Offset corrected by _R. J. Mathar_, Feb 05 2009
